Reviews.Title: “Too much noise, bad view and location”
Reviews.Author: christina a Posted by an Apollo traveler
Reviews.Content: At first, it seemed as if the hotel was a nice place with a high standard. But that changed. We had paid ekstra to get a better room, and the room in itself was ok, but the location was terrible. No balcony, and view was to a narrow alley. Traffic noise at all hours, and the hotel had a bar which kept playing music at disco-high levels until 3 am in the morning, so sleep was impossible. Luckily, we had brought earplugs, but the cleaning-staff threw them away, and though we complained, the hotel staff did nothing to reimburse us or buy us new ones. Breakfast was ok, but not a 4 star level - and the reataurant looks like a cheap diner or cafeteria. Not recommendable, since Dubai has so many other hotels to choose from.

Reviews.Title: “Great stay”
Reviews.Author: Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: The bed was very comfortable, Internet was free, they brought fresh complimentary fruit to snack on and the resturaunt and bar was very nice. I had an excellent stay here. Downside, it was a bit far from the metro, attractions and airport.

Reviews.Title: “Gold Swiss hotel dubai/Mercure Gold”
Reviews.Author: kathysw49
Reviews.Content: Just returned from a 2 night stay at this hotel. Enjoyed our stay and the only downside was the delay in them picking us up from the port after our cruise. The company we booked with had arranged for them to do this but as there was a conference at the Trade Centre they were taking people there and left us standing at the port. They apologised and when we finally got to our room it was very nice, quite spacious clean and modern. We didn't have much of a view but then we didn't intend to spend time in the room. staff very friendly and helpful. Breakfast buffet was of a good standard and we enjoyed the pool area when the weather permitted. We also had the pizza deal around the pool area which we thought was good value for a 4 star hotel. We also used the Mercato Mall shuttle which worked out fine but there wasn't too much there to spend the 3 hours between pick ups. We took a taxi to the Dubai Mall which was only 20dhs so that was good value. Quite a few restaurants and fast food outlets in easy walking distance. We had only stayed in the beach area before but it was nice to be in a different area for a change and the weather wasn't really suited to the beach due to the very windy conditions.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent friendly service at all times!”
Reviews.Author: paa s
Reviews.Content: After our visit I wanted to thank personally for their overwhelming very nice and friendly staff all over the hotel including cleaners and all staff!!! Your staff is absolutely great. Big special thanks too for the guys behind the Liquid Lounge bar selling desk, they're very great and entertaining. Special thanks aswell for the Indian guy named HARPREET SINGH, he was absolutely friendly and helpful at all times and he entertained the customers all the time, give this man a big raise, he definately deserves that!! :) I bet we will visit your hotel in the upcoming next years because of your very friendly staff. Only and only minus is that there is no balcony in the rooms.

Reviews.Title: “Great Stay”
Reviews.Author: contactpriyesh
Reviews.Content: Overall really good stay at this hotel. We booked 2 rooms and both were clean and plush. Hotel staff were friendly especially the bellstaff. Hotel is walking distance to some great local restaurants which you may want to check out because food at the hotel is relatively expensive. Taxis are fairly cheap around Dubai Some guests might find the music from the restaurants in the lobby noisy at night. Personally we were all too tired from a full day of shopping/adventure to notice.

Reviews.Title: “Unhelpful”
Reviews.Author: CatherineKuwait
Reviews.Content: We stayed in the hotel 29th Dec 2011 to 2nd Jan. The room didn't get cleaned until the third day, because I have poor health and returned to our room at about 3pm for a rest, the cleaners still hadn't got around to our room, despite the fact when we left our room at 10am we put the 'please clean' sign on. What is the point of having this system if it isn't used, we had to ask the cleaners to come at 10.30am on the 3rd day. And even then, not all the litter was cleaned away. We constantly had to ask for more teabags and water as they only provided 2 at a time.The hotel was in the process of changing hands, which we weren't informed about previously and when we asked the simple question of what was the balance on our room, they couldn't help us cos they 'didn't know the new system' surely training should have been given beforehand!!! The A/c in room was noisy and the new years eve party going on the rooftop till 3am was far far too loud and kept us awake. We could never get to sit around the rooftop pool as it was always too busy. Because of the changeover, the room service list disappeared from our room. Staff far too unhelpful. Far too expensive to stay as we didn't even get breakfast in with the tariff. And the 'high speed' internet was very very slow. Will not be staying here again.

Reviews.Title: “The Kebab Connection - Improve more on service.”
Reviews.Author: maheshjaigadkar
Reviews.Content: Me and my wife had visited yesterday to this restaurant considering to celebrate our wedding anniversary at an Indian restaurant. The ambience of the restaurant was very good with a proper set up and a live Indian band. I would like to say thanks to the male singer for his excellent performance and also for performing recommended songs by the guests. Being a Gold Medalist in singing and a stage performer, I can easily recognize his voice quality and I greeted him also after end of their band. Keyboard and rhythm players need to concentrate more on music rather than chatting between them so that they can put their best. As we are fond of kebabs, we have ordered set menu to enjoy the food. But there was almost 10 minutes delay for serving next kebab and later unless we look at the counter no service was provided for serving kebabs. I informed about this delay to one of the captains also. Due to this delay, we lost the craze and taste of kebabs and then we asked them to start main course and further desert. The quality of the kebabs was okay but can be improved more. Finally, it took almost 2 hours to complete the entire set menu. It is very important that the food is served to the guests without any delay in service so that the guest does not gets upset. We were offered a discount as we were making the payment through credit card which was good but it was not important for us as we came there to enjoy the food.

Reviews.Title: “Good place for short stay at Dubai”
Reviews.Author: yury98
Reviews.Content: The hotel has appeared good. I lived in superior room. The area of room is about 40 meters. It has both a bath and a shower. The sanitary technician is normal, all works. There is safe, an ironing table with the iron, a desk, an armchair with a floor lamp. LCD TV 25 inches with many channels, but with Russian language is only musical “TV Chanson”. It is better to take rooms at higher floor. On the first it is audible music from night club. There is small pool on a roof, but very pleasant. Water temperature is about 29 degrees, works till 20.00. It is possible to take pool towels to the beach. Breakfast is standard, quite good choice of dishes. But Coffee from coffeemachine is for charge. There is a parking in a cellar, doorman takes your car to parking and returns it back for your need. Hotel has free buses: - A beach 9.00, back 12.30 - Mercato Mall 11.15, back 16.00, 16.15, back 19.15 - Outlet Mall 17.55, back 22.00 Location is quite good (but I have hired car). To a public beach is about 2 km, within 1 km it is a lot of cafes, restaurants. Nearby is supermarket Carrefour. Cons: paid Internet WiFi 20 AED half hour, wired (at room) 30 AED per hour (for comparison - at nearby places - 5 AED per hour). To hotel management: 1. there is no this hotel at http://www.swiss-belhotel.com/. It is strange. 2. Please make WiFi free! 3. Please connect Russian news channel (like Russia Today or 1TVrus).

Reviews.Title: “Hopeless”
Reviews.Author: sweekarnayak
Reviews.Content: The hotel staff is non cooperative. The hotel is fit for only business tour not for leisure. please ask superior rooms if anybody wants to stay. Quite far from airport. Food is good. Available all type of food.

Reviews.Title: “Good Place”
Reviews.Author: drmathewjohn
Reviews.Content: Located in Burdubai, this is a very nice place. The restaurants are nice and serve tasty stuff. Stayed there for 2 nights. The rooms and bathrooms are clean and nice. The service is nice and fast. The front reception was very polite and helpful. The check in and check out formalities were crisp. The concierge was great. Bad: I found a suitcase and a pair of shoes in my room which was not mine . It was likely left by the hotel on instructions of the tour operator and not their direct responsibility. But I suggest that no one other than the hotel staff should enter a guest's room without the guests' permission.

Reviews.Title: “Enjoyed my stay, wouldn't mind staying again.”
Reviews.Author: Natalie_S1
Reviews.Content: We booked this hotel for a weeks stay.. and the hotel was nice clean and comfortable. There was 3 of us there were not enough beds so had another bed put in. I had a huge bigger than king size bed which was great. There was a seperate sitting area within the room which was nice however it was quite tight. When booking with EXPEDIA we was told the room could accomodate upto 6 people. We were three and were finding it overcrowded. This was EXPEDIAS FAULT not the hotel's. Loved the shower facility was great and clean. The hotel was a little away from Dubai central so needed to catch a taxi to and from the hotel. There was no shuttle bus service. There was a room with access to the internet which you was charged for for the hour. The staff were very helpful and guided us where to go etc. Generally was a nice stay.

Reviews.Title: “A simple and newly renovated hotel in a decent location”
Reviews.Author: Helder K
Reviews.Content: With a group of friends for a full week's tourism in Dubai, we decided to try the hotel, and since the first contact was made, I found the staff completely friendly and helpful. Mrs. Agnes in special was pivotal in making sure she would find us the best package possible. The hotel though seems to not be known around, and it is easier to mention staright that it is next to the "Capitol Hotel", then it is easier. We used taxis regularly and it will take you AED16 to get to Dubai Mall. The room as well as the hotel in general was very clean with no major complaint on this. Our room though, didn't have a good view as it was at the back of the hotel, but we didn't spend much time in the room anyway... Internet speed was very good; We ended up having some issues with the internet in the room which was supposed to be free, but ended up just ignoring it. Breakfast was simple with a nice variety of options and in general was good. I cannot comment on the other meals as we never tried it during our stay. They have also got a good basic gym and pool at the rooftop, supported with an interesting Spa. All in all, for what we were prepared to pay for the trip, it was just what we asked for! Just as a matter of interest, there is an annoying music in the background that plays in the lounge as well as in the restaurant, that starts getting to your nerves as time goes by... At least we found it annoying... As it is the same music consistently every single day at all times.

Reviews.Title: “Cockroaches”
Reviews.Author: Jon2314
Reviews.Content: We booked this hotel via lastminute.com top secret hotels; CHIC & CONTEMPORARY HOTEL IN BUR DUBAI. So you could say we were taking a chance, but you do not expect cockroaches in the bedroom and bathroom of a 'new' 4* hotel. Our experience was not 4*, the staff were few and far between on arrival to the hotel. They seemed over busy. Upon entering the room there was an open service hatch in the ceiling which was evidently faulty (didn't shut properly). It was temporarily fixed promptly on request. The location of the hotel is a bit 'in the middle of nowhere', you need to travel by taxi, or there is a bus stop outside the hotel, but you may end up on a bit of a lengthy trip to get anywhere via bus. When we complained about the cockroaches in our room we were handed a 'customer satisfaction survey' to fill out, not offered any apology or explanation. We did fill it out with our complaint but have had no response. You could tell the cleaning was 'surface cleaning' and not thorough, we cant comment on much else as we did not want to spend much time at the hotel. Not impressed, I think there are much better options out there.

Reviews.Title: “Really golden experience”
Reviews.Author: meetheen
Reviews.Content: It was a good experience from the arrival to the departure. The only problem noticed is the delay in check-in and check out.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Hotel Would go back again”
Reviews.Author: Dhimdhim
Reviews.Content: Nice modern hotel. Very clean and friendly staff. We were a group of eight and had booked four double rooms. Nice size rooms. Easy access to everywhere via Taxi. We rented a Minibus for the two days and our mobility was great and did not have to worry about parking. The hotels travel desk organized everything Gulmira and her team took care of us. Vinod was also very helpful at the front desk and Faisal took care of us with the transport arrangements. We had not included breakfast with our room but ended up eating breakfast there both days( a little pricey 75 AED). Good variety healthy choices. The only comment I will make is the stains on the carpet in two of the four rooms we stayed in. this needs to be looked into. Otherwise a great hotel.

Reviews.Title: “First Trip To Dubai”
Reviews.Author: SteveM2
Reviews.Content: My Wife and me have just got back from Dubai. Stayed at Swiss Belhotel. The location was a bit away from the attractions so we had to use Taxis a lot.The Taxis were clean and good value. Overall the Hotel wasn't bad. The room was very comfortable and the roof top pool was good. The restaurant was a bit canteenish but the breakfast choice and quality was good. The Senses Lounge tried to be a Pub and Night Club which didn't work as you could not hear yourself speak and the lighting was too subdued. We ended up drinking at the Ramada across the road because of this. The serving staff were friendly but the front desk staff were not totally efficient. If I went back to Dubai I would probably choose another Hotel although I woud not be too disapointed if I had to use this Hotel again

Reviews.Title: “is nice to see that you made friends”
Reviews.Author: gabpop
Reviews.Content: My last trip in Swiss Belhotel was in July. I stayed then a longer period and as I remember I made a review at that time. So when I was back, this month, I was really good surprised to see that the staff remembers me, both with my habits, too. Also, as i made this period 2 times check-in (short business trips reasons) each time I received nice free fruits baskets from the hotel, as considered already an old and regular client . The check-in - check - out was very fast & easy, as usual. As hotel guest, got following facilities, during my stay: - free internet; - free pick-up / drop-in from.to airport; Also, as i had late trips during my stay, the management of the hotel accepted to make late check-out, no charging for this. The room charge was little bit higher than in July, but was normal, as long as the season restarted in Dubai. Anyway, was much cheaper than other similar hotels and included, as mentioned, a lot of facilities. For me the quality of the services and hospitality remained the same; as mentioned I felt like home there, a difficult task for a hotel to satisfy the clients with different culture and habits. As changes from the previous visits: the evening singers from the main restaurant were replaced with new ones (I say a good replacement, as the repertory is much various now). Also, if last time, was steaks - house each evening, this time was not more but I was told that will be prepared something new. As I had to leave, hope to find the new surprise for clients next time. Overall, I have the same good impression as last times and I was really pleased to be treated like an old guest whom habits are already known from now. So, for Dubai travels, even business or private, definitely I will use the same hotel services.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Vishal75
Reviews.Content: We had gone and stayed at this hotel for 4 nts. and really enjoyed the stay. It was very relaxing and good rooms to stay at. The hotel is well placed from all the directions for travel and shopping hubs.

Reviews.Title: “Good and bad in relation to price.”
Reviews.Author: steelindustries
Reviews.Content: Very cheap hotel in comparison to other options for similar levels of room quality etc. However the service quickly shows you the difference in price equation. Stayed here for 5 nights a fortnight ago and was surprised initially with the quality of the room for $67 a night US. Room service however took our towels everyday and didn't return them unless we called and were subsequently told they would be "another 30 minutes" (whatever that means) or if we didn't call they simply weren't replaced. The towel quality is terrible and they were taken and not returned everytime without calling. The check-in experience was terrible and the check-out also very slow and draining. The breakfast buffet was average and over-priced and we went in 10 minutes before it closed without being informed of this at the door. After putting a plate down they informed us it was closing and to quickly grab another plate. Not good enough. The doormen were friendly and good at their job. Wouldn't stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Average hotel”
Reviews.Author: Imranz
Reviews.Content: Rooms are relatively small by Dubai standards. Breakfast and location were just ok, nothing too good and nothing bad. Room service, staff as well as the overall cleanliness was very good. Most of the rooms have no views or sunlight as their windows are facing each other unless you are lucky enough to get a room facing the road. The bathroom was impressive with an overhead shower compartment as well as a seperate bath tub.

Reviews.Title: “nice and comfortable hotel with friendly staff”
Reviews.Author: asim_modak
Reviews.Content: It is located at Bur Dubai. It is one of the finest 4 star hotels in Dubai. It is value for money for a stay at a luxury hotel. The staff was very helpful and friendly. The rooms were very clean and water was supplied daily. The breakfast was fulfilling and with wide selection. We found this hotel an ideal base for both shops and beach, within a 15 minute taxi ride of either. The hotel offers a courtesy bus to the beach and has a very warm pool on the roof!! I had a very comfortable stay at this hotel and will surely go back.

Reviews.Title: “Ok but overpriced for what is offered”
Reviews.Author: RUSH2
Reviews.Content: Nice quaint hotel, the rooms are on the smaller size and the room is crammed with large furniture pieces. Dont expect any views as all the windows look in or on poor view. The breakfast is expensive but not very tasty. Reception staff aren't very friendly.But againt the hotel is clean and has all the amenities. The pool is much smaller than the website pics. Would stay here again only if other hotels weren't available.

Reviews.Title: “Great value for your money”
Reviews.Author: Belle_Nay
Reviews.Content: An overall great stay. Hotel was your typical nice 4 star hotel and staff was very knowledgeable and professional. The pros - hotel decor looks new and modern looking - staff was very friendly and super helpful - taxis are always readily available - the rooftop pool and indoor lounge really nice - spacious suite - location ok, short taxi ride to beach, mosque, Dubai mall, Bur kalifa and museum. 5 min walk to a few casual restaurants The cons - no views outside your window - breakfast buffet food was mediocre - had to visit the front desk twice to resolve faulty room card issues

Reviews.Title: “WOW - A Memorable Stay”
Reviews.Content: Excellently and well located with proximity to all sight seing locations in Dubai. Very courteous and friendly & polite staff. Good restaurant that served us delicious food with pleasant service. Excellent hospitality. Felt homely and enjoyed our stay.

Reviews.Title: “a family hotel”
Reviews.Author: gabpop
Reviews.Content: A hotel relatively small 4 stars hotel (4 floors plus the 5th with SPA, fitness center and the swimming pool on the roof) with very friendly employees. The rooms are spacious, with all facilities included. Besides other 4 or 5 star hotels, the food is good and diversified, and has also alcohol. Are 5-6 types of beer, bottled or drought, international brands and at a relatively good price (circa 9 USD a pint of drought beer) Is accessible to go to the beach, are regular free of charge shuttles to mall, and is recommended (in my opinion) for the families with kids due to the accessible prices. Is recommended to check before booking the promotions, as they have always one. Has 2 restaurants and one bar in the lobby; for the amateurs of very spicy and hot food I recommend “Kebab connection” – Indian type food, where everything is spicy and hot, including the bread. For the others, the regular “buffet „restaurant offers a large diversity of food, as mentioned better quality and more dishes than a typical 5 stars hotel. Before the internet, LAN access in rooms, was payable; now is free of charge. As points to be improved: the policy of the hotel not to clean/supply the room in the day of departure (so if you leave late no chance of complementary water & instant café ) and no functional Wi-Fi connections, only LAN ones;. A problem would be the noise coming from the street, especially from the two adjacent streets on the laterals and back sides of the hotel, where sometimes are motor-cyclists crossing after 23-24 hrs, with hard noise – but nothing is perfect, isn’t it? Anyway, related to the value of the hotel vs. the costs, I recommend it.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent but Dubai has countless excellent hotels”
Reviews.Author: LeVisitant
Reviews.Content: Really enjoyed our 10 day stay in the March sunshine. The hotel is quite new and quite a few taxi drivers hadn't heard of it. I'm sure it will carve out a good reputation for itself but its location might be a problem. It's not near the seafront nor the creek and suffers from the general lack of amenities in the area. That said, there is a nice bar onsite (the Liquid Lounge) which features local entertainment and decent food but I wish they'd turn the AC down, it was freezing in there at times. We also had dinner at the restauarant and it was sumptious. Breakfast was less exciting, but ample. The rooms were beautifully finished and very peaceful: we slept well every night. Staff in the bar and restaurant were lovely but I despaired of the reception staff; generally inefficient and apathetic. Absolutely loved Dubai: the ostentatious shops, the souks, the desert heat,the historic Creek & Bastayika area and the glamour of the Burj al arab area. Can't wait to go back!

Reviews.Title: “Appreciation for Management & Staff-members (Particularly for Front Desk & House-keeping.”
Reviews.Author: kishore_kotian
Reviews.Content: Message to Hotel Management & Staff-members, Thank you very much for all the assistance & Hospitality that Management and staff rendered During our (Me & My family) stay in your Well organized hotel. Staff were very polite & courtesious. Will not hesitate to re-commend your hotel for any Visitor / Guest who will visit Dubai on Business or for Leisure.

Reviews.Title: “Disgraceful.”
Reviews.Author: TheydonBoisPeter
Reviews.Content: If you like a relaxing drink in the afternoon or evening in this hotel as there is nowhere else to go other than other hotels (all overpriced) do not expect to be able to do so at this hotel. On both days of our stay the bar had been booked for a childrens party and on the second day for the final of the cricket world cup. Guests at the hotel were barred because a ticket to enter was required. Guests at the hotel who had paid good money for the facilities advertised were refused admittance. Our room had quite clearly been used by smokers but we were not asked whether we would prefer a non smoker room and if you ask why we did not press the issue - after taking nearly two hours to check in by the unbelievably ancient process used we decided to make the best of a bad deal. The carpet in the room was dirty and needed a good clean. What the stains were shall remain a mystery. Breakfast was OK but the food was cold and the egg chef missing both days but cold scrambled egg was available. The hotel was sited close to the dock area and really in the middle of nowhere thus requiring taxis to get anywhere interesting. (many taxi driver did not know where the hotel was upon our return). Returning to the refusal of guests to use the bar our rooms were booked well before the cricket world cup and we paid via a travel company ROL together with many other guests for the full advertised access to the facilities offered. The management was at fault and spoiled the last part of our holiday. Would we use this hotle again?? NO NO NO

Reviews.Title: “I was Treated like royalty”
Reviews.Author: Wayne_c_Scott
Reviews.Content: For the price, the hotel has many things to offer...two excellent restaurants, the spa, a bar with social but relaxing night life, and an excellent staff. The hotel is in a central area from the Gold Souk, Al Karama, Mall Of Emirates, and the Burg Kalifa, the worlds tallest building. If that does not tickle your interest, there are friendly booing agents in the hotel lobby that can book one of many tours the city has to offer. I feel like I am advertising for them but the truth is, I had a wonderful stay at the hotel. They really made me feel special and welcome. WS

Reviews.Title: “Gold Swiss Belhotel Dubai has got experienced personnel”
Reviews.Author: SNR79
Reviews.Content: I stayed with my family in Gold Swiss Belhotel Dubai in March 2011. I was really pleased with high level of professionalism and hospitality of the hotel personnel. The personnel is also very helpful and experienced, especially reception, house keeping and guest relations. The hotel itself has very good location, near to Malls with free shuttle bus services provided. When we come to Dubai next time we will stay in this hotel again.

Reviews.Title: “Superb service - the staff made our holiday magnificent”
Reviews.Author: KFrandsen
Reviews.Content: The hotel is excellent, and the service, the very nice staff in the front office supplied, was nothing less but outstanding. They were so concerned about helping us with anything, booking the attractions we´ve thought about before the journey, researching to provide us with the informations we requested and guided us as first-time visitors in Dubai, so that we could enjoy our holiday. We send our greatest thanks to these wonderful people and highly recommend the hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Well positioned, great food and good sized room.”
Reviews.Author: OrkneyIslandsTerrors
Reviews.Content: We stayed one week here and although not blown away, it was a nice hotel. Close to airport, so take a taxi rather than booking an airport transfer. Reception staff were not the most helpful but we didn't find them rude. Bar and restaurant staff were all very friendly and helpful. The food was really good. We were staying B&B and the breakfast was good with a lot of choice and plentiful. We also had the buffet dinner twice and found it to be of good value and quality. The pool area is not very big but I think they could put some more loungers out. The one area I think they need to improve is tourist information. There was a real lack of information on what to do and how to travel around. Also, was surprised to have no free wifi in any part of the hotel. Would recommend it for a short stay on a budget.

Reviews.Title: “Good city hotel”
Reviews.Author: VasilyKh
Reviews.Content: We spent a week in this hotel (28 Dec - 04 Jan). General impression from the hotel is good - but withought any enthusiasm or rejection because some shortcomings and positive sides are combined. Minuses: - Room was realy small. We occupied Premier room and size of this was insufficient for 2 adults and 2 childs (13 and 1,5 y.o.). Possibly it was our mistake and we need to book suite - but we were disoriented by description of this room type on the hotel site (37 sq. m). Of course we did not measure the room size by ruler but it looks smaller. - Very often clean person forgot that there are 4 person in the room and gave us 2 complects of towels only. - There is no any view from the window (no balcony) - really you can see the other wall of the hotel. Pluses: - Hotel has a perfect location for the city hotel - most of attractions are easily achieveble by taxi (Jumeira and Al Mamzar beaches, Burj Khalifa, Wild-Wadi aquapark etc.) - Meal was very good ( we had HB). Live music in execution of 2 Russian girls during dinner is very pleasant also. - Hotel staff was very polite and helpful - and very kind for our small daughter As a resume I can say that it was good trip from Moscow -20C to Dubai +25C - one week of summer in the heart of snowy winter.

Reviews.Title: “Good and bad”
Reviews.Author: L-Cay
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Gold Swiss five nights over christmas and had a mixed experience. First the bad things: Before going there we wanted to confirm our booking, but the reception didn't answer our emails so we had to call get the reservation confirmed. Well in Dubai, It started really bad when the airport transfer we ordered from the hotel didn`t show up, so we had to take a taxi. The driver then didn´t know the hotel (actually no driver did during our stay), so we had some problems getting there. Well there we realized we hadn´t gotten the upgrade we were promised when we booked. The rooms where nice and spacious, but had a foul smell. We had some problems with the cleaning. Three days in a row we didnt get any new towels even though they had taken the old ones, so we couldnt have a shower. There are wifi in the lobby, for which they charge loads and loads. Not acceptable in the year 2010. And now the plusside: The breakfast were really good, and the restaurant staff are very nice and professional. The pool area is small but well kept, and same goes for the gym. There is a free shuttlebus going to the beachpark. We used only once though because the cost of a taxi going there is low, about 13 aed. We found the location to be perfect both for exploring and going to the beach.

Reviews.Title: “Fabulous hotel, good location and friendly staff”
Reviews.Author: Teresa L
Reviews.Content: My husband and I have just returned back to Hong Kong from a 6 night stay at Gold Swiss-Belhotel Dubai. We were there to attend a trade fair with a few extra days beforehand to enjoy Dubai. This is our third time to Dubai but the first to this hotel and now that I know my way around, I would definitely recommend this hotel for several reasons. For a start, the location avoids the busy traffic congested area of Bur Dubai or Diera but if you want to visit these places you can easily take a taxi, they are not far. Alternatively if you want the beach you are 5 mins away by taxi and another good point is that we never, not once, had to wait for a taxi as there is a bunch of them right outside the hotel. Our room had everything we need and Housekeeping did a splendid job of cleaning our room spotlessly each day, once we left the Do Not Disturb light on by mistake and they ended up cleaning our room at 10pm! Beds are comfortable, the rooms are quiet and modern with flat screen TV's and internet. The breakfast buffet is the full works with western, Mediterranean and local choices such as cereals, croissants, fresh breads, cold cuts, cheeses, fresh fruits etc We had one dinner at "Kebab" and the food was excellent, I am trying hard to find a fault with our experience but it's not easy ! Oh and there's a nice pool on the roof, it's not big but it's very nicely landscaped and they have a gym with top-of-the-line equipment, Nautilus was the brand of machinery, it's a pity it was not used much then again Dubai is not a place you watch your weight! The staff were very friendly and helpful and I would recommend this hotel to anyone for either business or pleasure.

Reviews.Title: “never again”
Reviews.Author: naz2803
Reviews.Content: me and my husband stayed at this hotel early october the service we received was a disgrace i would not recommend this hotel to anyone it is no where near a 4 star hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Glorified 3 star hotel”
Reviews.Author: alghoya
Reviews.Content: After reading good reviews about this hotel I was shocked by the service or should I say lack thereof when we stayed there Sept 25-Oct 4, 2010. From the beginning we should have known that this wasn’t the hotel we expected to stay at. We had to call four times to get driving directions from the airport (we rented a car). We finally had to ask a taxi driver for directions to the hotel next door because it is known. We arrived around 7am so we were told that we would have to wait a couple hours for our room to be ready. When it was “ready” it seems that the housekeeping forgot to clean the bathroom. It was dirty with a clump of hair on the floor. We requested to have it recleaned when we went out which resulted in a semi-surface cleaning. The next night we asked for an electrical adaptor and were told one would be sent up. Thirty minutes later called again and was told it would be sent. Then three hours later when we called to complain, we were told that there weren’t any available. The front desk person could not provide a reason why we were told differently the two times earlier. A few days later another clump of hair was found in the shower. Ironically when we got locked out and asked housekeeping to open the door we said that we had complained so it was better to go to the front desk to have the card fixed. After five days complaining cleaning was better yet still not what you would expect from a 4-star hotel. This hotel is really a gloried 3-star establishment. If you do decide to stay there I hope Katrina checks you in and Ubra cleans your room. The Bellhops are all friendly and go out of their way to help getting in/out of the car.

Reviews.Title: “Avoid!!!”
Reviews.Author: raposaraposa
Reviews.Content: Terrible service, STEALING from the rooms (very smelly rooms, we had to buy some air fresheners in order to be able to stay in the room)

Reviews.Title: “I've been back, back and back”
Reviews.Author: Chris2travels
Reviews.Content: I've been traveling for business for five years and recently have been to and through Dubai almost monthly staying at several other hotels. A colleague recommended this hotel. I visited. I came back two weeks later. I'll be back next week. It has excellent rooms, very helpful staff, and a good location. I would recommend this hotel to a friend, to a business colleague, and my boss. My family would love it.

Reviews.Title: “Recommended”
Reviews.Author: immos
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for a total of 6 nights in January. Good value for money, rooms are new, large and with all standard amenities that is needed. Fast and efficient service, both in the reception and from roomservice. In house restaurant good for breakfast, recommend that dinner is had outside of hotel. Nice beach within walking distance at Jumeirah, taxis are however a necessity to go anywhere else. Nice roof terrace with a small pool, however it could have held some more sunbeds. All in all - we would stay again.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel with excellent staff”
Reviews.Author: Prakash05
Reviews.Content: We stayed at Gold Swiss-Belhotel for 5 nights in executive suit and our overall experience was superb. An amazing hotel with modern amenities and 5 star service quality. Suits and room are specious and very nicely designed with lots of dressing and storing cabinets. Rooms are very neat, clean with very warm and cozy feelings and very comfortable bed. Bathroom are fine and specious with bath tub and shower cubicle separately. Hotel is centrally located and convenient to reach from anywhere in Dubai. The breakfast at the restaurant Senses is outstanding with huge variety. Lunch served was really sumptuous. The best thing which invites you to visit and stay again in this hotel is its amazing staff. We found all employees very welcoming with smiley faces specially the concierge and boys at the main door. One minus is the pool at the roof top which is very small. Newly renovated spa looked very inviting but I left for the next visit. As the hotel is fairly new, make sure you have address or tell taxi driver that it's next door to Capitol Hotel.

Reviews.Title: “New, clean, good value”
Reviews.Author: GCCtraveller
Reviews.Content: Only stayed 2 nights but the hotel was very nice, new and clean, highly recommended. We got a free room upgrade, thank you. Great location, next door to Capitol hotel (great lunch buffet - cheap) and very close to Jumeira Rotana hotel and shopping strip. The rooftop pool is very small but OK. The happy hour (2-for1 cocktails) was also a good value for money. Will be back!

Reviews.Title: “Feels isolated”
Reviews.Author: LoveIt77
Reviews.Content: Dubai is a bit odd in that there is no "centre". This hotel feels like it is in the middle of nowhere but then again, I am sure most hotels do. It is decent. Staff were helpful and everything was as expected. Rooms are average in size and comfort. The hotel feels a bit impersonal. Breakfast buffet is pricey and only average. We picked this hotel as it was between "old" and "new" Dubai and because it was rated high on this site. Taxi rides are cheap and it didn't take us long to get to most places in the city. Very small pool on the roof that we didn't use but there were some chairs and a life guard. I imagine you have to pay a lot more to get a more elegant hotel experience in Dubai so this hotel is probably good value. Nothing bad to say about it.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent stay for the ATM in Dubai in May”
Reviews.Author: SDANDND
Reviews.Content: We have just returned to the UK from our business trip. We wanted to thank you and your team very much for our stay at your hotel in May. Our rooms and the service we received were excellent. Everyone at the hotel made us feel very welcome, the care taken made our visit to Dubai a great success. It is always difficult to mention everyone, but we would be grateful if you could pass on our thanks to Laveena in the Indian restaurant, Paulina at breakfast and Lucy the room attendant who were outstanding. Thank you once again for an excellent stay and your kind attention to us. Simon Davies

Reviews.Title: “A new hotel with extremely targeted services and amenities”
Reviews.Author: mywhereabouts
Reviews.Content: I've recently spent 10 days at the Gold-Swiss Belhotel Dubai, a new property opened in Autumn 2009. Its location is quite convenient as it lies in Bur Dubai close to the main districts but on a tranquil road. Cosy Arabic architecture which makes it stand out among the other buildings and a well-appointed wide lounge where several facilities and services are available: reception, concierge desk, tour desk, business centre, three restaurants, shop, beauty centre, lifts and a comfortable sitting area with a beautiful piano too. Very nice is the corner dedicated to the traditional Beduin camp. The rooms are subdivided into several categories: I stayed in a Premium Room. Wide, carefully furnished and properly enlightened, it offers a big wardrobe, tea & coffee making facilities, minibar, large bed with comfortable pillows, bedside tables, ample writing desk, captivating red armchair with footstool, side-board and luggage board. The bathroom is particularly pleasant and functional (though lacking of a bidet) as it offers separated bath and shower. Many mirrors (not only in the bathroom) including the make-up one allow you to check your look from all perspectives. Among the most appreciated amenities, the ironing tools (including the board) and the safe. The wired high-speed internet connection is unfortunately charged (rate per hour AED 30 - around Euro 6 - which is rather expensive). Located at lounge level and called "Senses", the breakfast room/restaurant is bright, wide and well furnished. Every day there is some new food and beverage on breakfast: generally speaking, there is a choice of various small cakes, bread (to be also toasted), jams/marmelades, honey, juices, milk, yogurts, smoothies, fresh fruit (both entire or cut into pieces), corn, chocko and bran flakes, dried fruit, bircher müsli, cheese and lots of salted preparations, fresh salads and tomatoes. Live cooking station with a chef constantly available from 06:30 to 10:30h to prepare your crepes, omelette and much more. The attentive staff serves hot beverages at your table. At the entrance a good number of newspapers and magazines is available for free, but only in Arabic whereas every brochure, city map and information sheet is always available in English too. On last day of my stay I also spent a couple of hours at the pool on the rooftop. It is quite small but offers a cosy panel with small waterfalls and an area equipped with sun beds and umbrellas. Bath towels are free. You just have to pay attention to the black tiles as they can become slippery when wet; nevertheless, they are alternated in chessboard-style to the grey ones which are not slippery. It is definitely a hotel which I would recommend for its extensive range of effective services and amenities available as well as for the comfort it offers, its reasonable rates and convenient location (however, some slight improvements about the expertise of a part of the staff at the reception and/or concierge desk would be appreciated). On my birthday, I was pleasantly surprised to receive from the hotel management a slice of cake with their wishes. Have also taken advantage of the effective daily free shuttle service to the Dubai World Trade Centre for an important tourist event which I had to participate in as well as of the transfer service from and to the airport.

Reviews.Title: “Good good good.......”
Reviews.Author: SamiyaA
Reviews.Content: We liked this Hotel very much. We stayed for 3 days and everything was excellent. Room was clean and nice, very tasty breakfasts, wonderful cuisine, cheerful bar... Very good and betimes service. Good location, there are lots of cafes, restaurants, shops & etc. near there. Working staff are very nice, very smiling and executive, very helpfull... I'm very happy that we chose this hotel...

Reviews.Title: “4 start hotel 5star quality and performance”
Reviews.Author: scouce
Reviews.Content: we spent 3 nights in this hotel. the location was ok. hotel transport picked us up from airport. that was good. evrything was well organised on arrival. they made us feel relaxed after a flight. All the staff were excellent. All members of staff made us feel welcome.. The room was nice and clean, the quality of the breakfast was excellent. we were both surprised at the freshness of the food. my compliments to all in the restaurant. Every menber of staff was helpful and made their best effort to help us. We would like to compliment the manager as he is doing a fine job.. and ask him to complment his staff on doing an excellent job. thanks.

Reviews.Title: “GREAT MODERN & NEW HOTEL”
Reviews.Author: uptonuponsevern
Reviews.Content: After arrival into Dubai Airport early morning after a very long direct flight from Sydney Australia I noticed a hotel staff member with my name printed in large letters on a board waiting for me & escorting me by taxi to the hotel, arriving around 07:30am the reception staff were very pleasent without any fuss & allowed me to check into my room long before the normal time of 2pm. At first when entering the classic room I was rather disappointed that the room appeared much smaller than the impression from the photo over the internet, only two other negatives about the classic room was that the lighting in the bathroom was very dim & had a shower hose above the bathtub without any curtain or glass panel, therefore after taking a shower the whole floor was completly satuated. I mentioned this to the reception staff & within a very short time upgraded me into a much larger room at the same rate, nice to move around in my room & enjoy the relaxing modern bathroom. B/fast was well presented with many choices & waiters & waitresses were very polite & professional. Decided to try the massage on the 4th level again very relaxing & professional with a good rate of 250 AED for 90 min's. On the roof-top a small pool with only a few sun beds, with a good view towards the city. Small shop within the hotel lounge area, useful for stamps, but rather expensive especially when buying gifts! Had a good hotel meal in the Kabab Connection Resturant, only downfall only a couple of other guests inside, Indian music being played late, pleasent if your not sleeping above! Free Hotel shuttle bus either to Dubai Mall or to Jumeirah beach area which ran in both directions a couple of times a day. Never had any problem in finding a taxi outside the hotel, just a couple of times the taxi drivers would try to take the long way back on my return to the hotel, after a pleasent reminder that I knew where I was heading for they appeared to head direct in the right direction! Never used the internet it appeared very expensive. Staff were very helpful in advicing on booking intresting tours especially to the BURJ AL ARAB HOTEL for cocktail drinks and spent around 2hrs looking & taking many photos of this fantastic hotel. The Gold Swiss bel- hotel is roughly 15min's by taxi to Dubai Mall & around 20-25 minutes to the airport. After my 10 night stay & continued on to the UK for one month. I decided after one month in the UK to return to Dubai & re-stay at this hotel for an extra 4 nights before returning to Sydney, again very pleasent stay. With the total 14 nights including B/fast, complimentary pick up from the Airport, free shuttle bus, I feel 4950AED was fantastic value. Booked most of my tours with Orient tours over the internet before leaving Sydney e.g The Golden City half day tour, day return tour to Abu Dhabi, Dubai Museum, many shopping centres, Big Bus night tour, Desert Safari, Dhow Cruise/Dinner, Burj Al Arab Hotel, and finally my most enjoyable part was entering AT THE TOP-BURJ KHALIFA TOWER, daytime & night time highly recommended for the fantastic views, if you wish to read up on the design of this fantastic building & watch the video's before entering into the lift and the same when returning the whole experince can take up to 3 hrs without rushing, also great value 100AED & very well planned, and admire the views without being rushed.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel- 4* with 5* service”
Reviews.Author: NargizAzerbaijan
Reviews.Content: Well I do not know what to start with.....We have been surfing a lot to find a good family hotel which would respond all our family needs in terms of cleanliness, being new, amenities, breakfast and etc. and at the end of the day our travel agent had recommended us this hotel as he had recently been in a tour in Dubai for new hotels. From the very first day of our visit we were travelling with my husband, daughter and my mom we enjoyed this place. First of all the location is pretty good, on a quiet road with supermarket, great Iranian and Chinese restaurant, pizza places, supermarket opposite to the hotel. The hotel can be easily found if you mention Capitol hotel - Al Mina road so that you are sure that the taxi finds it. The customer service is also great - we came in (we booked 2 rooms) within a 15 min time we have been given the keys from the room, a shuttle service bus schedule which is very handy because you will spend a lot on taxis in Dubai. The shuttle bus has 3 directions : Beach (with a nice garden in front of the beach where you can have a nice walk and take great photos), Merkato Mall which is on the way to the beach, and the Dubai Mall which will save you at least 40-50 DHS a day if using this service, it is also not far from Dubai Mall and Burjuman Mall. The room was great and spacious, nice furnishing and modern fittings. The bath room is also spacious and has a great water pressure. We experinces NO problem with hot water and the room service at all. EACH request from the reception or the room attendant was satisfied in minutes. The room was cleaned EVERY day and was SPOTLESS. The hotel has a nice pool on the roof which is very good to have after a long, hot and tiring day in Dubai. The water is 25-29 C and is well maintained and controlled. My daughter had a great experience there both in the mornings and evenings. The good thing about the pool is that it is partly covered which is handy for those who do not want to sunburn. Breakfast: There was a selection of white and brown bread, also cookies like croissant and other. We also had tried sausages, pancakes, fried eggs and etc. They serve good cappucino and coffee, various yougurts. The hotel had a various selection of fruits as well. Everything very fresh and delicious. Despite the reviews of travellers about poor service i would say on the contrary that it WAS JUST GREAT. Me and my family still talking about this hotel and recommend our friends to definitely stay there. The hotel has 2 restaurants : Kebab connection and Senses. We did not try them as we were out very often. A drive to Deira from hotel costs around 22 DHS, drive to Wild Wadi aquapark costs around 45 DHS, take a taxi from WILD WADI to Emirates Mall which will save you money it will cost you only 8 DHS but you will pay 10 as min fare in Dubai taxis. I can write a long story about this hotel however it would not express all my impressions about it unless you try it yourself. Do not hesitate to stop your choice on GOLD SWISS BELHOTEL and you will DEFINITELY not regret this GREAT choice.

Reviews.Title: “No problems”
Reviews.Author: magpie_rover
Reviews.Content: We arrived in the early hours of the morning after lengthy customs at the airport. We were quickly shown to our room and unlike previous TA reviewers had no problems with the booking, didn't even show any paperwork. We did have trouble getting into the room as the batteries had gone in the electronic door lock however someone came to fix it within a few minutes, the room we were given had been used by smokers so we asked to change and again that was no problem at all, we were tranferred to another room immediately. We only stayed 2 nights on route to Thailand so didn't eat at the hotel although we did call into the bar for a couple of drinks and there was a couple of singers on which were pretty standard hotel singers. Our room was spacious and comfortable and everything we needed. Location was fine, we walked as far as the Burj Khalifa in the daytime and used the new metro system which was easy to do, will be even better when all the stations open.

Reviews.Title: “Silly Name - Good Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Doffa
Reviews.Content: The name of this hotel is quite silly (especially if you are asking for directions nobody seems to understand it) but this is a very good hotel if your have you rown car since the sights / malls are too far for walking (the hotel has a shuttle to a mall though). There is a Dominos Pizza and a Korean restaurant in 1 min walking distance.The hotel seems to be quite new therefore our room was in a perfect condition and very clean (the AC is a bit windy). Breakfast very good. Excellent value for money.

Reviews.Title: “OK hotel but no customer service!”
Reviews.Author: Blackmountain122
Reviews.Content: Have to echo the views of other TA guests, nice hotel, in fairly good location but no customer service. Reception needs to learn how to smile and apologise for their mistakes. Make sure you take a copy of your booking with you, and also print screen if booking through FastBooking (using hotel's own website). Breakfast was poor, with no option for continental breakfast. Swimming pool extremely small; there's a real lack of sunbeds for those guests wishing to soak up some rays in between the sightseeing. Watch out for rooms facing the main road or on the corner of the building, above the bar, as the road noise is almost continual through the night, and a couple of nights we were kept awake by the music from the bar downstairs. None of the taxi drivers we used had heard of the hotel, so you'll need to use the nearby hotel, the Capitol, for directions. Good points: OK location, 10 minutes to Deira and the Creek, 20 minutes to Emirates Mall. Nice message, using the hotel's spa, reasonable price.

Reviews.Title: “Poor service from Reception- best avoided!”
Reviews.Author: busbridge40
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for a week over Christmas.Booking an Executive Suite through Expedia which was meant to sleep up to 5 people.We booked for 4 and found the rooms overcrowded with furniture and our confirmed booking seemed to take them by surprise.The reception staff grudgingly organised two feeble fold up beds which meant we were crammed in like sardines.They offered to give us the space we thought we had booked for a "special price" (£400 a night is quite "special").This hotel has possibly the smallest 4* pool in Dubai with only 4 sunbeds.The reception tried to charge a small fortune for the included breakfast.Make sure you photocopy your booking because they take it away from you in order to back out on the deal.Luckily, we moved to the Movenpick for New Year which blew this one away!

Reviews.Title: “The lack of customer service really lets down a lovely hotel!”
Reviews.Author: Londoner033
Reviews.Content: We arrived at the hotel at 11pm after a long flight and they could not find our booking. The Duty Manager called 'Hamiath' was completely pathetic as he kept disappearing inside the office every 2 minutes without giving us information about whether we had a bed for the night. After waiting for 20mins, he did not even tell us that he had found our booking. He then said that it hadnt been confirmed but then I pointed out that the booking form had my credit card number on it and had been confirmed. 'Oh yes' he remarked without any type of apology. Then 20 mins further, they still could not find us a room as they were so booked up. They only had a twin room for my husband and myself even though we had wanted a double. Once again no apology and he just kept disappearing into the back office. Eventually we just took the twin room as we were so tired. When we got to the room, it was a SMOKING room and we had booked a non smoking room. Our clothes started smelling of cigarette smoke. We told the staff and they said that it would take an hour to put us in a non smoking room. The duty manager Hamiath came over to us with my booking form in his hand and started saying that we hadnt requested a non smoking room but once again I had to point out with my finger where i had requested it on the booking form and then got quite angry with him but once again he said nothing...not even sorry! He is a complete waste of time and should go back and get some more training! Especially on how to read a simple booking form. We were offered no complimentary drinks or food while we waited for our room. It was a disgrace! We finally got into our room at 1AM and were so angry and upset!!! The next day we were moved into a double room but it was so inconvenient moving luggage around etc. There were other problems too as one day we were not given any towels in the room and had to call up for them. Another day the restaurant staff rang our room at midnight to ask if we could bring down a receipt that the waiter had accidentally handed to us as they needed it for the accountant...i was in complete shock that they would ring so late but they had no idea!! Basically the hotel is nice and clean and in a good location but the staff are inexperienced and very immature! I think that staff from other SwisBel Hotel Chains need to come and monitor what is going on there and really show them what to do. I would not stay there again. Also it took us 40mins to check out as there was 1 person at the front desk during 11am which is peak checking out time!! PATHETIC!!!!

Reviews.Title: “Good Value”
Reviews.Author: Rumples
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for six nights on an excellent Internet rate and considered the hotel to be extremely good value, even with a $20 buffet breakfast and taxi fares to get to places of interest. The good-sized deluxe room had a large bathroom with a tub and a separate shower stall, a flat-screen TV, lots of drawer space, comfortable beds, a safe and two free bottles of water daily. Our room overlooked an interior space and was extremely quiet. The hotel offers a free shuttle to Jumeirah Beach Park once daily and the Dubai Mall offers free pickup and return to this hotel and others on a schedule throughout the day. We found the staff to be attentive and helpful. On the "con" side, we generally eat lightly at breakfast so would have preferred options in addition to the buffet but nothing else was offered. No places served breakfast within walking distance of the hotel. The air conditioning in our room was set too low and it was impossible to get the temperature any higher with the controls. Overall, we were extremely satisfied with this hotel and recommend it as a reasonably priced place to stay in an expensive city.

Reviews.Title: “The Best Value Business Hotel in Dubai”
Reviews.Author: Brazukajo
Reviews.Content: I have stayed in Swiss Bell , 5 times, eventhough it openned a few months back! My last stay february 2010. The hotel is great, brand new, with confortable rooms , great staff . The restaurants are fantastic, in special the kabab connection and the breakfast. Rooftop swimming pool with temperature control, so you can always enjoy it! The location is very convenient, next to the Trade Center, Carrefour express, many fastfood close by, Salsa Club , where you can have salsa classes on the corner of the road for (only 8 USD pera 40 minutes) and 5 minutes from Dubai Marine, where you find clubs, (including Boudour) , arabic bar where you can famous shisha , Roberto Cavalli restaurant and bar 5 minutes. Jumeirah Beach is just 5 minutes away . Shuttle bus to major malls and airport. It is just great.

Reviews.Title: “New and still ironing out some teething problems – but good value.”
Reviews.Author: Lewnatic
Reviews.Content: My wife and myself stayed at the Gold Swiss Belhotel for 6 nights in January and for the most part, thoroughly enjoyed our experience. This is a very new hotel (opened a few months ago) and there are a few small issues which they have not yet got quite right, but I believe they are working on them. The hotel has two restaurants and a lounge bar, with a small rooftop pool, where you can order snacks and drinks. The area round the pool is quite small and there are only about six loungers and a few tables/chairs, so it can get full quite easily. There are good views of the Dubai skyline from the roof. We did not eat in the Kebab restaurant, so cannot comment, but the food in the other restaurant – Senses was excellent. The breakfast buffet was very extensive – both hot and cold with eggs and omelettes made to order. In the evening the two dinners we had were also very well prepared and presented. The only downside was the lack of support for the restaurant – on both evenings there were perhaps only another two or three tables occupied in what is a fairly large area – this was a shame. One criticism was that a dinner buffet deal which was on offer early in our stay (and which was extremely good value) was withdrawn without notice. The bar has a happy hour from 6pm – 8pm with 2 for 1 drinks – a pint of Stella cost 32 dirhams. The location of the hotel is OK – between the old town area and Jumeira beach, however neither area is realisticaly walkable. The hotel runs a free shuttle bus to the public beach at Jumeira (5 dirhams entry) – leaving at 10:30 and returning at 2:30 – this was good. There are also shuttle buses running to two of the malls, however, what the timetable doesn`t tell you is how long it takes to get there. For the Dubai Mall which is ten minutes away by taxi, the bus takes over an hour. Taxis are usually available outside the hotel and are reasonably priced – although the private luxury cabs are about 50% more expensive than the marked licensed taxis. There are a couple of restaurants opposite the hotel – Chinese and Iranian – we didn`t try them. A bit further along on Al Diyafah Road (5 minutes walk) there is quite a selection of restaurants. We at in a Lebanese place Al Mallah – which was remarkably cheap - £20 for two courses for two. The hotel will organise transport from/to the airport at 100 dirhams – more than a standard taxi – but there is some comfort in pre-booking – particularly for pick up at the airport where it can get very busy. The staff were all very polite and welcoming and always tried to sort out any issue we had. We drew the manager`s attention to a couple of these and he was quick to respond and act – treating our comments as constructive. We got what I thought was a very good deal for bed and breakfast – around £110 per day – including taxes – which are 20% ! All in all I would say the hotel is well worth considering if you don`t want to be on the beach or right in the town.

Reviews.Title: “On a Learning Curve”
Reviews.Author: anticorpo
Reviews.Content: This hotel has just opened doors and one will feel it. There has been a series of minor mistakes , delays and unappropriate handling of things during our stay which lasted one week or so. Major justification : it was Year End and the hotel had 100 % occupancy . The ratio price/quality of the establishment is excellent but this hotel is not terribly classy, better to be clear. The frontdesk is small , congested and not too polished. Concierge desk seems anonymous. The bell-boy is here and there and not always in front of the door. We did not like the restaurants , very ordinary-looking , noisy . I wouldn't go there not even free of charge. Breakfast closes at 10.30 , which is too early for holidaying people , I would assume. On the other hand, the hotel is very clean with the sweet spot being the room, which is indeed excellent for the price. I personally liked the location, very airy ; my son didn't. The management of the hotel has been extremely responsive to my factual complaints and , afterwards , treated us very well . Things went much better . I would go back.

HotelInfo.Name: Mercure Gold Hotel
HotelInfo.Address: Al Mina Road Bur Dubai | PO Box 66431, Dubai, United Arab Emirates (Formerly Gold Swiss-Belhotel Dubai)
